title: Dinaric Alps
summary: The Dinaric Alps (/dɪˈnærɪk ˈælps/),[1][lower-alpha 1] also commonly Dinarides, are a mountain range in Southern and Southeastern Europe, separating the continental Balkan Peninsula from the Adriatic Sea. They stretch from Italy in the northwest through Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Montenegro, and Kosovo[lower-alpha 2] to Albania in the southeast.[2][3]
